data.question: What is the main goal of the research article?
data.answer: The main goal is to boost the separation of ethane from ethylene using isoreticular ultramicroporous metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) with weakly polar pore surface for strengthened binding affinity toward ethane over ethylene.

data.question: What are the names of the two isoreticular ultramicroporous MOF materials discussed?
data.answer: The two materials are [Cu(ina)2] and [Cu(Qc)2].

data.question: Which MOF material exhibits a smaller pore aperture size, [Cu(ina)2] or [Cu(Qc)2]?
data.answer: [Cu(Qc)2] exhibits a smaller pore aperture size of about 3.3 Ã….

data.question: Why is [Cu(Qc)2] considered a superior ethane-selective adsorbent?
data.answer: [Cu(Qc)2] is considered superior because it has a higher C2H6/C2H4 uptake ratio of 237% and selectivity of 3.4, indicating stronger binding affinity for ethane over ethylene.

data.question: What experimental technique was used to determine the binding conformations of gas molecules in [Cu(Qc)2]?
data.answer: High-resolution neutron powder diffraction (NPD) measurements were used.

data.question: True or False: The introduction of large substituted organic moieties always increases the gas uptake capacity of MOFs.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of the self-adaptive pore structure in [Cu(Qc)2]?
data.answer: The self-adaptive pore structure in [Cu(Qc)2] maximizes the quantity and contact area of adsorbate-adsorbent interactions, resulting in larger binding affinity for ethane over ethylene.

data.question: True or False: The C2H6/C2H4 selectivity of [Cu(Qc)2] is lower than that of [Cu(ina)2].
data.answer: False

data.question: What method was used to calculate the selective sorption performance of different MOFs?
data.answer: The ideal adsorbed solution theory (IAST) was used.

data.question: True or False: The density of encapsulated C2H6 in the pore channels of [Cu(Qc)2] at 298 K is close to the liquid C2H6 density.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the breakthrough experiment conducted at 298 K?
data.answer: The breakthrough experiment demonstrated that complete separation of C2H6 from a C2H6/C2H4 mixture can be realized at ambient conditions using activated [Cu(Qc)2], with C2H4 showing a desirable purity of over 99.9%.

data.question: True or False: The adsorption enthalpy for C2H6 is higher than that for C2H4 in [Cu(Qc)2].
data.answer: True

data.question: What does the term 'isoreticular' refer to in the context of the MOF materials discussed?
data.answer: Isoreticular refers to MOF materials that have the same framework topology but different pore sizes or functionalities.

data.question: True or False: The PXRD patterns of activated [Cu(Qc)2] remain unchanged after moisture exposure upon 98% relative humidity.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the main advantage of using adsorptive separation for ethane/ethylene separation over traditional methods?
data.answer: Adsorptive separation is more energy efficient than traditional heat-driven cryogenic distillation, as it can directly produce high-purity ethylene in a single operation with potentially lower energy consumption.

data.question: True or False: The adsorption isotherms for [Cu(Qc)2] indicate that it has a higher uptake capacity for C2H4 than for C2H6.
data.answer: False

data.question: What computational method was used to support the experimental findings regarding the binding affinity of [Cu(Qc)2]?
data.answer: Density-Functional Theory (DFT) calculations were used.

data.question: True or False: The Langmuir-Freundlich model was used to fit all the single-component adsorption isotherms for the MOFs discussed.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the main challenge in separating ethane from ethylene according to the article?
data.answer: The main challenge is the very similar molecular size and volatility of ethane and ethylene, making their separation energy-intensive and challenging.

data.question: True or False: The article suggests that all MOFs have high moisture stability.
data.answer: False
